text.title: HUGE OIL PLATFORMS DOT GULF LIKE BEACONS
text.author: By ASHRAF FOUAD
text.body: Huge oil platforms dot Gulf like beacons usually lit up like Christmas trees at night One them sitting astride Rostam offshore oilfield all but blown out water by U S Warships on Monday Iranian platform unsightly mass steel concrete three tier structure rising feet metres above warm waters Gulf until four U S Destroyers pumped some shells into U S Defense Department just pct one section structure remained U S helicopters destroyed three Iranian gunboats after American helicopter came under fire earlier month U S forces attacked seized sank Iranian ship they been caught laying mines But Iran deterred according to U S defense officials who Iranian forces used Chinese made Silkworm missiles to hit U S owned Liberian flagged ship on Thursday Sea Isle City on Friday Both ships were hit territorial waters Kuwait key backer Iraq war Iran Henry Schuler former U S diplomat Middle East now CSIS Washington agreed to escort Kuwaiti tankers order to deter Iranian attacks on shipping But he deterrence policy failed level violence threats to shipping increased as result U S intervention Iran s response attack on oil platform latest example U S tit for tat policy gave Iran initiative Harlan Ullman ex career naval officer now CSIS He appraoch America suffer the death one thousand cuts But United States to grab initiative militarily must take warlike steps such as mining Iran s harbors or blockading mouth Gulf through shipping must pass Schuler He among those advocating mining as means bringing Iran to neogtiating table If vital supplies were cut off Tehran could continue war Iraq Ullman Washington should join Moscow diplomatic initiative to end war superpowers should impose arms embargo against Tehran if refused to negotiate He United States should also threaten to mine blockade Iran if continued fighting must press Iraq to acknowledge responsibility starting war as part settlement Iranian Western diplomats say Iraq started war by invading Iran s territory Iraq blames Iran outbreak hostilities entailed World War I style infantry attacks resulting horrific casualties Each side attacked others shipping

text.title: DIPLOMATS CALL U S ATTACK ON OIL RIG RESTRAINED
text.author: By Ian MacKenzie
text.body: A U S attack on Iranian oil platform Gulf on Monday appeared to be tit for tat raid carefully orchestrated to be too provocative or upset Arab allies Western diplomats region U S Defence Secretary Caspar Weinberger Monday U S Warships destroyed oil platform southern Gulf response to missile strike on American registered Kuwaiti tanker Sea Isle City Kuwaiti waters on Friday We consider matter closed he signal U S administration did want Gulf crisis to escalate Iran warned United States earlier day against exacerbating Gulf crisis saying military action endanger American interests Following raid okesman Tehran s War Information Headquarters vowed to avenge attack crushing blow The United States entered swamp can no way get out safely Tehran Radio quoted him as saying Diplomats noted however Iran also seeking to avoid ostracism by Arab states due to meet at summit Amman on November discuss Iran Iraq war Iranian Prime Minister Mir Hossein Mousavi currently Damascus diplomats he seek Syrian help preventing total Arab breach Tehran Further escalation war threatening Gulf Arab states could work against Tehran at Amman gathering they The ball Iran s court now s up to Tehran to respond one way or other diplomat President Ronald Reagan warned Iran stronger American countermeasures if military escalation continued Western diplomats military sources area shelling platform appeared to be least provocative act United States could taken once decided to retaliate tanker attack blamed by both Americans Kuwaitis on Iran It s interesting they chose something international waters because doesn t implicate any other nation one diplomat This better U S Relations Gulf Arab states particularly Kuwait Commented another diplomat Kuwait must be happy U S done something but relieved Faw attacked on doorstep One source attack on oil platform They managed to warn off crew hit something least nuisance to everybody diplomat commented They were very clever place they chose gets attention but hasn t devastated anything because wasn t working first place senior Arab banker area after news broke This good measured response without risking flare up face saving response for Americans

text.title: LATEST ATTACK SEEN POINTING UP DILEMMAS FOR US
text.author: By CHRISTOPHER HANSON

reuters.text: VENEZUELA SAYS OPEC OIL OUTPUT VER MLN BPD CARACAS Oct The current OPEC oil production is above mln barrels per day bpd and this level threatens the precarious equilibrium of the of oil market Venezuelan Energy and Mines Minister Arturo Hernandez Grisanti said on Monday He told reporters three or four countries out of OPEC s members were mainly responsible for the overproduction but declined to identify them OPEC s production ceiling for the second half of is mln bpd The Venezuelan minister said OPEC s production reached a peak this year when it went over mln bpd in August Hernandez Grisanti together with the oil ministers of Nigeria and Indonesia met the heads of state of six Mideast Gulf countries earlier this month to urge OPEC members to comply with assigned production quotas He said some of the countries which were complying as Venezuela Indonesia Libya Algeria Ecuador Saudi Arabia and Iran Hernandez declined to say whether the three or four countries he said were overproducing bordered the Mideast Gulf REUTER

text.title: TRANSATLANTIC ROW IMPERILS LOUVRE ACCORD DEALERS
text.author: By Guy Collins
text.body: The Louvre accord on currency stability maintained uneasy calm currency markets since February appeared serious danger today as transatlantic dispute over West German interest rates came to boil foreign exchange dealers But as dollar slid against mark world stock bond markets plunged officials major industrial countries played down dispute as bilateral problem between United States West Germany insisted currency pact still alive U S Treasury Secretary James Baker sparked market fears when he attacked rise West German short term interest rates That s keeping spirit what we agreed to as recently as earlier month Washington Baker U S Television interview on Sunday He referring to meetings Finance Ministers Group Seven G leading industrial nations reaffirmed pact Under Louvre Accord West Germany Japan who both large trade surpluses pledged to boost their economic growth to take more exports U S While U S Agreed to stop talking dollar down However Baker on Saturday while Louvre agreement still operative West German interest rate move force U S To re examine accord The foreign exchange market been told by Baker he s going to hammer Germany He just declared all bets off terms currency cooperation Chris Johns currency analyst at UBS Phillips Drew London But Bank Japan official took much more sanguine view telling Reuters the exchange market apparently reacting too much anyone who sold dollar on Baker comment regret later on French Finance Minister Edouard Balladur who hosted Louvre meeting only one G Finance Ministers to respond directly to Baker s remarks He called a faithful firm adherence by all major industrial countries to Louvre accords both their letter spirit Neither West German Finance Ministry nor British Treasury commented on row But Japanese Finance Ministry official despite U S Frustration over higher interest rates abroad this does represent readiness to scrap basic framework Louvre Accord Frankfurt F Wilhelm Christians joint chief executive West Germany s largest bank Deutsche Bank following recent meetings Baker he believed U S still committed to accord move market interpreted as possible gesture reconciliation Bundesbank added short term liquidity to West German money market at pct on Monday down pct level at injected medium term liquidity week Bank France also stepped into French money market to hold down rates injecting short term liquidity at pct after rates rose close to eight pct

text.title: SWISS ANALYSTS SAY MOOD ON MARKETS PRECARIOUS
text.author: By Donald Nordberg and Michael Shields
text.body: Today s sharp sell off Swiss stocks matching falls around Europe may been overdone but mood on financial markets precarious Swiss securities analysts economists Panic selling took Swiss shares down six pct at opening on enormous volume triggered by slide on Wall Street threat renewed currency instability I never experienced anything like I ve been business years Bernhard Wyttenbach head European research at Union Bank Switzerland analysts blamed sell off Europe on U S Monetary authorities weekend U S Treasury Secretary James Baker publicly voiced his displeasure West German monetary policy He eight month old Louvre accord to stabilise currencies still working but added On other hand we sit back watch surplus countries jack up interest rates squeeze growth on expectation United States raise rates Hans Peter Ast Societe Generale Alsacienne Sogenal Zurich The situation very dangerous Statements by U S Authorities fuelled anxiety interest rates Herbert Fritschi director Zurich Cantonal Bank s financial research department called sell off overdone but warned situation could worsen unless central banks loosen their monetary policy I think trend toward higher interest rates over he The Federal Reserve Bundesbank to step easy money policy or else there going to be economic catastrophe They to act quickly Wyttenbach Black Monday sell off clearly exaggerated Swiss Reinsurance Co participation certificates falling pct value at one point But Wyttenbach he did believe correction come soon First bad news reach small investors only time tomorrow s market when there could be another smaller selling wave As soon as dollar stabilises s key then we ll get strong movement upward Wyttenbach But may come soon People simply worried America where market now fallen by pct since August bull market over he People afraid we ll recession Baker wrong to blame West Germans current problems weak dollar Wyttenbach We do mark problem we dollar problem he added but biggest culprit new chairman U S Federal Reserve Board Alan Greenspan Wyttenbach recalled Greenspan suggested dollar might be too high medium term interest rates might to rise As central banker he shouldn t do Wyttenbach There danger we fall back into s he We real crisis confidence Greenspan I much rather Volcker Paul Volcker retired as Fed chairman on August Cantonal Bank s Fritschi I m relatively optimistic because situation looks too bad Fed certainly to intervene He he did expect Swiss National Bank to take any significant steps adding focus attention remains on United States The panic started New York to end there Cantonal Bank sent advisory to customers suggesting they sell into panicked market but wait while before deciding what to do

supplies continue to bank on Saudi Arabian LPG sources They Saudi s supply capabilities LPG associate crude oil guaranteed by crude output capacity Saudi reliable supplier sense one trader Japan imports pct LPG Saudi Arabia No single nation could substitute Saudi Arabia as LPG supply source to Japan sources Saudi Arabia committed itself to Japanese LPG buyers quelled fears LPG supplies Mideast Gulf could easily be disrupted wake heightened hostilities area another trader Saudi Arabia cut LPG shipments to Japan elsewhere by pct September after fire put major gas plant at Al Juaimah out operation October shipments were back to contractual volumes as Saudi able to boost exports other ports Attacks on Gulf shipping by Iran Iraq centered on crude rather than products carriers lulled fears LPG supply disruptions traders They Iranian blockade Strait Hormuz unlikely because block Iran s oil shipments Industry sources Japan s LPG imports greatly rise or fall as domestic demand growth estimated at moderate pct year through Japanese term buyers Saudi LPG expected to lift slightly lower volumes January when imports Indonesia slated to increase sources customers unlikely to slash Saudi term purchases large scale when Japan increases annual imports Indonesian LPG to tonnes early tonnes year ended March sources But when demand sluggish summer they phase down term purchases Saudi LPG secure lower priced cargoes on spot market they Japan imports some tonnes LPG year tonnes supplied by Saudi Arabia under term contracts two through spot purchases Some pct Japan s LPG imports Middle East Saudi Arabia s state owned oil company Petromin made some concessions on term prices to Japanese customers recent round contract renewal talks likely Japanese accept offer sources Japanese term customers however so far been unsuccessful establishing transparent price formula to replace existing unilateral monthly price notice Japanese buyers pay Saudi Arabia price notified by Petromin each month Most recently FOB price set at pct dlrs per barrel government selling price GSP Arabian Light Buyers reserve right to phase down or out liftings should monthly price be set at over pct Arabian Light s GSP Petromin offered to lower rate to pct pct contracts Japanese customers next January trade sources Petromin also suggested seller s option supplying up to pct more than contractural to set price factor at to pct official at major importer Freight costs higher cargoes coming Gulf than Southeast Asia due to longer haul war risk insurance payments Japanese customers visit Saudi reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC GERMAN FINANCIAL POLI

text.title: GERMAN FINANCIAL POLICY MAKERS IN RARE DISSENSION
text.author: By Jonathan Lynn
text.body: Karl Otto Poehl head West Germany s central bank Finance Minister Gerhard Stoltenberg normally so much agreement some foreigners doubt central bank s independence But rare public row between ebullient Poehl president Bundesbank Stoltenberg over controversial investment tax proposal added to woes country s already nervous financial markets bankers Poehl told investment symposium Frankfurt Thursday he feared tax raise borrowing costs interest rates Stoltenberg quickly issued statement rebutting Poehl s criticism saying West Germany remain attractive place foreign investors The obvious lack coordination between Bundesbank Finance Ministry does instil confidence foreign investors one economist London broker who asked to be identified Bankers here expressed confidence two top financial policy makers quickly patch up their relationship to steer economy through particularly difficult time There plenty objective pressures result things getting back to normal again after period ill feeling Commerzbank AG chief economist Juergen Pfister News on October government planning pct withholding tax wiped billions marks off shares bonds market already reeling rising interest rates at home abroad Bankers Bundesbank angered by way finance ministry announced plan without consulting Bundesbank adequately allowing apparently conflicting details to dribble out into unprepared uncertain market Both Poehl Stoltenberg been under extraordinary pressures lately Poehl to switch to hard line promoted by his deputy Helmut Schlesinger jacking up interest rates to fight inflationary fears abandoning pragmatic policies he pursued so far year to promote currency stability recent statements Poehl sounded more like Schlesinger years softly spoken economist been warning speech after speech excessive money supply growth eventually lead to rising prices Schlesinger now majority support Bundesbank council since late summer Poehl to represent his views bankers Poehl minority his own house Commerzbank s Pfister Poehl dilemma He must follow policy entirely his own another economist dilemma if German interest rates rise too far they attract funds into country pushing up mark hurting West German exporters dollar now shed some seven pfennigs since Bundesbank s new tack became clear early October Since Thursday United States Treasury Secretary James Baker criticized Bundesbank rate increases Bankers could foreshadow revival war words between U S West Germany U S Officials talked down dollar to force West Germany to stimulate economy thus suck more U S Exports One way West Germany agreed to do making round tax cuts worth billion marks But financing these tax cuts proved more difficult Stoltenberg than he bargained cool unflappable northerner who regularly voted most popular government politician year to face resistance local barons government coalition parties trade unions to his planned subsidy cuts withholding tax intended to plug one gap by raising billion marks But caused outcry among bankers who say push up borrowing costs extra amount costs government could wipe out revenue tax brings Meanwhile Stoltenberg dealing local political row turned into country s worst political scandal Stoltenberg to leave monetary talks Washington month early to sort out row northern state Schleswig Holstein where he heads ruling CDU party state s CDU premier Uwe Barschel to resign after allegations dirty tricks election campaign led to heavy losses CDU state elections Barschel found dead hotel bath Geneva weekend Police say death appears to been suicide Cooperation between Poehl Stoltenberg all more remarkable as Poehl opposition Social Democrats appointed by former chancellor Helmut Schmidt When Poehl s contract came up renewal earlier year Chancellor Helmut Kohl s CDU led coalition government gave Poehl another eight year term Werner Chrobok managing partner at Bethmann Bank he hoped two men soon be one opinion again But when Poehl criticized Stoltenberg s tax plans he only voicing what many bankers felt but demonstrating Bundesbank s independence government Chrobok

text.title: LOUVRE ACCORD STILL IN EFFECT JAPAN OFFICIAL SAYS
text.author: By Kunio Inoue
text.body: The Group Seven G industrial nations still comply February s Louvre accord to stabilize currencies senior Bank Japan official U S Treasury Secretary James Baker s remarks at weekend indicating need to revise do herald lower range dollar other senior officials Bank Japan Finance Ministry agreed interviews The exchange market apparently reacting too much anyone who sold dollar on Baker comment regret later on Bank Japan official told Reuters Bank official Baker did mean to talk dollar down lower dollar harm U S Economy he noted Finance Ministry official who directly involved monetary talks other nations also U S never attempt to lower reference range dollar against mark or yen market assumes dollar reference range to be between yen between marks dollar closed Tokyo today at marks yen Behind Baker s remark U S Frustration over higher interest rates abroad especially West Germany but does represent readiness to scrap basic framework Louvre accord Finance Ministry official He on contrary Baker wanted to avoid any further rise U S Interest rates because only hurt U S Economy but aggravate Third World debt problem Higher U S Interest rates merely raise their interest payment burden depress U S Stock bond markets further monetary officials Both ministry central bank officials who declined to be named noted U S No longer wants to see further decline dollar because could also fan inflationary expectations U S That s why Baker did fail to add Louvre agreement still operative senior ministry official Baker U S Television interview on Sunday Washington reexamine Louvre accord because West Germany s increase short term interest rates market at first interpreted as indicating U S be ready to scrap Louvre accord let dollar decline further unless surplus countries notably West Germany try harder to stimulate their economies as pledged accord foreign exchange dealers But market on reflection also noted Baker s additional statement the Louvre agreement still operative caused some dollar short covering Tokyo today dealers Uncertainty however remained flavour day Tokyo currency markets Japanese monetary officials Baker s undisguised pressure on West Germany to refrain guiding interest rates higher may be part process multilateral surveillance or international economic policy coordination G comprising U S Japan West Germany Britain France Italy Canada agreed to monitor each other s economic policies time to time apply peer pressure to persuade others to change their policies to desired course they noted Without such basic agreement multilateral surveillance Baker never criticized West German policy so openly ministry official U S West German squabble over Bonn s monetary policy should thus be regarded as process healthy policy coordination as any indication possible collapse Louvre agreement official He also Japan received any specific request U S On monetary policy although short term money rates been edging higher This because we unlike Germans taking policy to guide interest rates higher marginal rate rise recent days primarily seasonal reasons he added

text.title: ABE TIPPED TO BE NEXT JAPANESE PRIME MINISTER
text.author: By Yuko Nakamikado
text.body: No clear indication emerged victor race to succeed Prime Minister Yasuhiro Nakasone but political analysts becoming more likely former foreign minister Shintaro Abe be chosen decision on three contenders be picked expected late today or early on Tuesday they Japanese political leaders held flurry closed door meetings today three candidates called on Nakasone who due to step down late month to mediate to break deadlock other candidates Finance Minister Kiichi Miyazawa former Finance Minister Noboru Takeshita They vying post president ruling Liberal Democratic Party LDP who automatically prime minister by virtue party s parliamentary majority new LDP president be named formally at party convention on October elected prime minister by parliament probably on November LDP sources Nakasone due to retire on October after five years post exceptionally long term by Japanese standards Takeshita who head party s largest faction steadfastly opposed idea seeking Nakasone s help but he told reporters It possible Nakasone be given carte blanche for selection his successor One political analyst who declined to be identified Nakasone despite personal preference Miyazawa likely to choose Abe as best candidate steering Japan through international problems maintaining party unity Abe also also accept Nakasone s influence he Analysts one Nakasone s prime aims to retain as much power as possible following his retirement Takeshita early favorite because size his faction viewed by many politicians analysts as being unsuitable post prime minister because his lack international experience analysts Nakasone also very unlikely to support Takeshita s bid because differences their political styles

text.title: TOKYO DEALERS SEE DOLLAR POISED TO BREACH YEN
text.author: By Rie Sagawa
text.body: Tokyo s foreign exchange market watching nervously to see if U S Dollar drop below significant yen level dealers The yen level key dollar because considered to be lower end reference range If currency breaks through level may decline sharply Hirozumi Tanaka assistant general manager at Dai ichi Kangyo Bank Ltd s international treasury division dollar at yen at midday against Friday closes New York here dollar opened at yen fell to low marks against New York here on Friday after opening currency s decline due to remarks on Sunday by U S Treasury Secretary James Baker dealers The dollar fell over weekend on increased bearish sentiment after Baker s comments Dai ichi s Tanaka He stemmed mounting concern cooperation among group seven G industrial nations to implement Louvre accord to stabilise currencies might be fraying dollar s fall also prompted by record one day drop Dow Jones industrial average on Friday weakness U S Bond prices dealers Baker Louvre accord still operative but he strongly criticised West German moves to raise key interest rates Operators took Baker s comment to indicate impatience some G members failing to stick to Louvre accord due to their fears increasing inflation Rises interest rates aimed at dampening inflationary pressures also slow domestic demand West Germany Japan both pledged at G meetings to boost domestic demand to help narrow huge U S Trade deficit Tanaka U S August trade data showed U S Deficit at still massive billion dlrs But if West Germany raises interest rates run counter to pledge he Operators now waiting to see if G nations coordinate dollar buying intervention Soichi Hirabayashi deputy general manager Fuju Bank Ltd s foreign exchange department target range set by Louvre accord generally considered to be to yen dealers The market likely to try yen level near future at time if operators see G nations failing to coordinate intervention they see Louvre accord as abandoned push dollar down aggressively Hirabayashi He U S Currency could fall as low as yen soon
